usa: The Twelfth Amendment to the United States Constitution was ratified.
Burr–Hamilton duel: Alexander Hamilton was fatally wounded.
Lewis and Clark began their journey west.
U.S. presidential election: Jefferson was reelected President; George Clinton was elected Vice President.
australia: A settlement was founded at Risdon on the Derwent River in Van Diemen's Land by Lt. John Bowen.
Castle Hill convict rebellion, also known as the second Battle of Vinegar Hill, occurred in New South Wales.
The Risdon settlement was moved to Sullivan's Cove (now Hobart) by Colonel David Collins.
